str2: A primary particle; properly, at the 'same' time, but freely used as a preposition or adverb denoting close association.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To hope, hope for, expect, trust. From elpis; to expect or confide.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Money, riches, possessions. Something useful or needed, i.e. Wealth, price.
Wherefore, on which account, therefore. From dia and hos; through which thing, i.e. Consequently.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To send for, summon. From meta and pempo; to send from elsewhere, i.e. to summon or invite.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Frequent, often, much. From the same as skenopoios; clasped, i.e. frequent; neuter plural frequently.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From homilos; to be in company with, i.e. to converse.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
